body_content.explanation: the quality of fitting the body too closely:
an uncomfortable feeling of pressure in the chest, throat, or a muscle:
examples: One of the typical symptoms of anxiety is a feeling of tightness in the chest.

body_content.explanation: the quality of looking or sounding as if you are angry, frightened, or nervous, and not relaxed:
examples: There was a strange tightness in her voice.

body_content.explanation: the quality of being held or kept together firmly:
examples: Check the tightness of the screw.

body_content.explanation: the quality of being pulled or stretched firmly:
examples: Pegs are used to adjust the tightness of the strings.

body_content.explanation: the situation when people in a competition, race, etc. are of a similar standard so it is difficult to know who will win:
examples: the tightness of the presidential race

body_content.explanation: the quality of curving sharply, not gradually or loosely:
the quality of having a close relationship and knowing each other very well:
examples: the tightness of the military community

body_content.explanation: the fact that there is not much of something such as money, space, or time:
examples: We are constrained by the tightness of the budget.

body_content.explanation: (of controls, rules) the quality of severely limiting what can happen:
examples: the tightness of food hygiene regulations

body_content.explanation: (of a performance or band) the quality of being exact and of a high standard because people work well together:
examples: The orchestra played with the tightness and precision of a military band.

body_content.explanation: the quality of being unwilling to spend money:
examples: She left, fed up with his affairs and his tightness with their household money.
